SENT.plain: A 24-year-old male with chronic atrial standstill underwent an electrophysiologic study
No atrial activity was recorded from the right atrium which did not respond to stimulation with up to 10 volts
After the administration of atropine, non-localized split atrial potentials appeared, and intraatrial phase 4 block and atrial flutter with intraatrial 2:1 block were observed
The atrium then responded to electrical stimulation (less than 2 volts)
Persistent sinus node activity with intraatrial block was found during post-pacing atrial pauses
